Pete O
Times B-ORG
: O
Some O
Florida B-LOC
legislators O
want O
to O
give O
people O
the O
right O
to O
shoot O
an O
attacker O
in O
a O
public O
place O
. O

A O
House B-ORG
committee O
voted O
Wednesday O
to O
allow O
people O
to O
shoot O
to O
kill O
in O
self-defense O
if O
they O
are O
attacked O
`` O
in O
any O
other O
place O
where O
he O
or O
she O
has O
a O
right O
to O
be O
. O
'' O

Sponsored O
by O
Rep. O
Dennis O
Baxley O
, O
an O
Ocala B-LOC
Republican O
, O
the O
bill O
( O
HB O
249 O
) O
passed O
13-0 O
. O

State O
law O
defines O
deadly O
force O
as O
that O
which O
is O
likely O
to O
cause O
'' O
death O
or O
great O
bodily O
harm O
, O
'' O
such O
as O
firing O
a O
gun O
at O
a O
person O
or O
a O
vehicle O
. O

Florida B-LOC
courts O
consider O
deadly O
force O
a O
last O
resort O
and O
have O
held O
that O
a O
person O
being O
attacked O
has O
the O
`` O
duty O
to O
use O
every O
reasonable O
means O
to O
avoid O
the O
danger O
, O
including O
retreat O
, O
prior O
to O
using O
deadly O
force O
. O
'' O

But O
this O
legislation O
says O
a O
person O
who O
is O
under O
attack O
in O
a O
public O
place O
`` O
has O
no O
duty O
to O
retreat O
. O
'' O

`` O
Law-abiding O
people O
should O
not O
be O
told O
that O
if O
they O
are O
attacked O
, O
they O
should O
turn O
around O
and O
run O
, O
'' O
NRA B-ORG
lobbyist O
Marion O
Hammer O
told O
lawmakers O
. O

`` O
This O
bill O
gives O
back O
rights O
that O
have O
been O
eroded O
and O
taken O
away O
by O
a O
judicial O
system O
that O
at O
times O
appears O
to O
give O
preferential O
treatment O
to O
criminals O
. O
'' O

Baxley O
held O
up O
a O

of O
more O
than O
800 O

from O

who O
he O
said O
have O

. O

, O

, O
have O

, O
and O

John O
A O
For O
my O
holiday O
post O
, O
I O
offer O
a O
message O
of O
hope O
for O
the O
business O
world O
. O

In O
1994 O
, O
I O
was O
a O
graduate O
student O
in O
Boston B-LOC
. O

I O
was O
asked O
to O
moderate O
a O
panel O
discussion O
on O
social O
entrepreneurship O
for O
a O
conference O
at O
Harvard B-ORG
Business O
School B-ORG
. O

The O
conference O
was O
being O
held O
by O
a O
new O
group O
called O
Students B-ORG
for O
Responsible O
Business B-ORG
. O

I O
expected O
to O
see O
a O
small O
gathering O
of O
idealistic O
, O
slightly O
naive O
MBA O
students O
. O

What O
I O
found O
was O
a O
packed O
room O
of O
200 O
intelligent O
, O
practical O
, O
driven O
idealists O
. O

These O
students O
were O
determined O
to O
figure O
out O
how O
to O
use O
business O
as O
a O
driver O
for O
positive O
social O
change O
. O

I O
left O
that O
room O
with O
my O
eyes O
open O
to O
the O
possibilities O
presented O
by O
these O
future O
business O
leaders O
. O

Fast O
forward O
10 O
years O
. O

Students B-ORG
for O
Responsible O
Business B-ORG
is O
now O
called O
Net B-ORG
Impact I-ORG
. O

In O
2004 O
, O
I O
had O
the O
opportunity O
to O
attend O
their O
conference O
hosted O
by O
The O
University B-ORG
of O
Texas B-ORG
McCombs I-ORG
Business O
School B-ORG
. O

Net B-ORG
Impact I-ORG
had O
grown O
to O
include O
over O
9,000 O
MBA O
students O
and O
alumni O
. O

Approximately O
900 O
people O
attended O
the O
2004 O
conference O
. O

The O
buzz O
words O
flying O
around O
the O
conference O
included O
social O
entrepreneurship O
, O
sustainable O
profitability O
, O
working O
with O
passion O
. O

I O
met O
student O
after O
student O
intent O
on O
harnessing O
the O
forces O
of O
business O
and O
capitalism O
to O
improve O
the O
world O
. O

These O
students O
understand O
that O
business O
is O
a O
powerful O
lever O
of O
change O
in O
this O
world O
. O

Recently O
business O
schools O
have O
received O
their O
share O
of O
criticism O
for O
turning O
out O
graduates O
who O
seem O
to O
have O
lost O
sight O
of O
their O
responsibility O
for O
ethical O
action O
. O

I O
can O
tell O
you O
that O
I O
am O
seeing O
a O
powerful O

of O
change O
coming O
from O

. O

It O
is O
not O
coming O
from O
the O
faculty O
, O
or O
the O

, O
or O
the O

. O

All O

to O

to O
topics O
of O

while O
avoiding O
any O

innovations O
in O

student O
experiences O
. O

The O

is O
being O
demanded O
by O
the O
students O
. O

A O
little O
secret O
of O
business O
schools O
is O
that O
MBA O
students O
have O
an O
immense O
amount O
of O
sway O
. O

Few O
choose O
to O
use O

, O
but O

can O

their O

. O

now O

for O
more O

of O
these O
topics O

are O

support O

for O

to O

discuss O

, O

, O

, O

is O
often O

. O

These O

... O
This O

I O

that O

are O

and O

of O

... O

John O
A O
Socially O

. O

Corporate O

responsibility O
. O

Just O

these O

some O

The O

that O

is O

of O

. O

You O
know O
, O
the O
one O
that O
says O
`` O
Poor O

. O

If O
only O

understood O

, O

would O

your O
ways O
. O
'' O

I O
do O
not O

to O

though O
interesting O
, O
avoid O
a O
simpler O
question O
. O

Do O
measures O
of O
corporate O
social O
responsibility O
contain O
valuable O
added O
information O
that O
help O
investors O
pick O
winning O
investments O
? O

If O
all O
that O
you O
have O
read O
about O
this O
topic O
is O
an O
article O
in O

Wall B-ORG
Street O
Journal B-ORG
, O
you O
've O
probably O

-- O
the O
evidence O
is O
mixed O
. O

That O
is O
true O
but O
not O
very O
revealing O
would O

you O
say O
? O

Evidence O
is O
mixed O
mostly O
because O
( O
1 O
) O
there O
is O
little O
agreement O
about O
how O
to O
measure O
social O
responsibility O
and O
( O
2 O
) O
many O
current O
measures O
toss O
together O
a O
heap O
of O
information O
that O
has O
no O
business O
being O
lumped O
together O
. O

Social O
responsibility O
often O
includes O
everything O
from O
treatment O
of O
employees O
to O
type O
of O
product O
produced O
. O

There O
is O
not O
really O
any O
reason O
to O
believe O
that O
selling O
guns O
or O
tobacco O
has O
anything O
to O

with O

employees O
to O
work O
unpaid O
overtime O
. O

Yet O
both O
get O
lumped O
together O
in O
the O
socially O
responsible O
investing O
discussion O
. O

Once O
you O
start O
to O
break O
apart O
social O
responsibility O
into O
its O
various O
components O
, O
you O
start O
to O
see O
the O
valuable O
information O
. O

Companies O
that O
have O
poor O
employee O
relations O
tend O
to O
underperform O
, O
as O
do O

that O

than O

violations O
do O

do O
worse O
than O

and O
companies O
that O
sell O
your O
typical O

sin O

products O
( O

, O

. O

Lump O

Taken O

MOSCOW B-LOC
( O
AP B-ORG
) O
Russia B-LOC
has O
accepted O
a O
US O
$ O
150 O
million O
World B-ORG
Bank I-ORG
loan O
to O
combat O
the O
spread O
of O
AIDS O
and O
tuberculosis O
, O
ending O
a O
negotiating O
process O
that O
lasted O
four O
years O
, O
World B-ORG
Bank I-ORG
officials O
said O
Friday O
. O

The O
World B-ORG
Bank I-ORG
first O
offered O
the O
loan O
in O
1999 O
, O
but O
disagreements O
over O
treatment O
kept O
the O
project O
on O
hold O
. O

Russia B-LOC
objected O
to O
World B-ORG
Bank I-ORG
rules O
that O
required O
monitoring O
of O
patients O
receiving O
medication O
, O
the O
World B-ORG
Bank I-ORG
said O
. O

But O
after O
drawn-out O
talks O
, O
President O
Vladimir O
Putin O
signed O
off O
on O
the O
loan O
, O
which O
will O
take O
effect O
this O
year O
, O
the O
World B-ORG
Bank I-ORG
said O
. O

`` O
Russia B-LOC
has O
one O
of O
the O
fastest O
growing O
AIDS O
epidemics O
in O
the O
world O
'' O
and O
has O
a O
`` O
fearsome O
'' O
problem O
with O
tuberculosis O
, O
particularly O
drug-resistant O
strains O
, O
said O
Olesoji O
Adeyi O
, O
a O
World B-ORG
Bank I-ORG
health O
specialist O
. O

`` O
It O
's O
a O
potential O
dual O
epidemic O
, O
'' O
he O
said O
, O
adding O
that O
people O
with O
immune O
systems O
weakened O
by O
the O
AIDS O
virus O
are O
especially O
vulnerable O
to O
contracting O
TB O
, O
which O
he O
called O
an O
`` O
opportunistic O
disease O
. O
'' O

AIDS O
came O
relatively O
late O
to O
Russia B-LOC
, O
but O
spread O
rapidly O
, O
primarily O
due O
to O
intravenous O
drug O
abuse O
and O
a O
lack O
of O
prevention O
programs O
. O

Officials O
have O
registered O
more O
than O
230,000 O
cases O
of O
HIV O
, O
though O
health O
experts O
say O
the O
actual O
number O
of O
HIV O

tops O
1 O
million O
. O

Tuberculosis O
, O
meanwhile O
, O
has O
also O
emerged O
as O
a O

, O

in O
Russia B-LOC
's O

the O
design O
was O
a O
prototype O
Pentium O
OverDrive O
with O

. O

changed O

and O

, O

( O

) O

Muslims O
in O

Monday O

openly O
for O
the O
first O

in O
decades O

's O

, O
as O

on O

that O

on O
a O

to O

on O

. O

's O

of O

's O

`` O
